details.content: CLICK HERE FOR EARLIER UPDATES

details.title: J&K: Mata Vaishno Devi Temple to reopen for public today after 5 months
details.content:
Jammu & Kashmir: Mata Vaishno Devi Temple will reopen for public today, nearly 5 months after it was suspended due to COVID-19. Only 2,000 people will be allowed to visit the temple per day. A devotee says, "I'm happy that people can visit the temple once again." pic.twitter.com/BDYQA1z5WK

— ANI (@ANI) August 16, 2020

details.title: It will be a year before Covid vaccine is ready: WHO scientist Soumya Swaminathan
details.content: The World Health Organisation is raising funds globally for people to get the Covid-19 vaccine free of cost. Currently India is only in the first phase of vaccine trials and it will take at least a year for the vaccines to be finalised, according to WHO chief scientist Soumya Swaminathan. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India reports 63,489 new cases as tally rises past 25.89 lakh
details.content:
Spike of 63,489 cases and 944 deaths reported in India, in the last 24 hours.

The #COVID19 tally in the country rises to 25,89,682 including 6,77,444 active cases, 18,62,258 discharged & 49,980 deaths: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare pic.twitter.com/55ZQrgdo0P

— ANI (@ANI) August 16, 2020

details.title: US crossed 50,000 deaths in 23 days, India took 156 days: Health ministry
details.content:
With a sharply falling Case Fatality Rate below 2%, India has one of the lowest #COVID19 mortality globally. USA crossed 50,000 deaths in 23 days, Brazil in 95 days and Mexico in 141 days. India took 156 days: Ministry of Health pic.twitter.com/dX472FDe0I

— ANI (@ANI) August 16, 2020

details.title: WATCH | 98-year-old war veteran defeats coronavirus
details.content:
98 years old War Veteran defeats corona.
Sepoy Ramu Laxman Sakpal(Retd) was admitted to Indian Naval Hospital Ship Asvini in a critical state,with Pneumonia due to COVID-19 a few weeks ago. He was given warm sendoff on 15 August #IndependenceDay 1/2@indiannavy@NewIndianXpress pic.twitter.com/4oEjfP9NL9

— Mayank (@scribesoldier) August 16, 2020

details.title: 'Condition much better, stable': Pranab Mukherjee's son gives former President's health update
details.content: Mukherjee's son said that the vital parameters of the former President, who underwent life-saving emergency surgery for the brain clot on August 10, following which his health status had worsened, are stable and he is responding to the treatment. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 1102 new cases in Telangana
details.content: Telangana's COVID-19 tally rises to 91,361 with 1,102 fresh cases; death toll reaches 693 after nine more patients succumb to the disease: Health Department's bulletin

details.title: 72-year-old prisoner dies of Covid in Kerala
details.content: Manikandan was hospitalized four days ago after he collapsed in the prison. During the medical test, he was tested positive for COVID-19. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: No community celebration, idol immersion at public places on Ganesh Chaturthi in Delhi
details.content: There will be no large congregations, community celebrations or idol immersion at public places on Ganesh Chaturthi in the national capital this year in view of the COVID-19 pandemic, according to the Delhi Pollution Control Committee.

details.title: Assam's COVID-19 tally tops 75,000 with 1,057 fresh cases; death toll climbs to 182
details.content: Assam's COVID-19 tally surpassed the 75,000-mark with 1,057 fresh cases, while the death toll mounted to 182 as eight more people succumbed to the virus, Minister for Health and Family Welfare Himanta Biswa Sarma said. The state's coronavirus caseload stood at 75,558, while 53,286 people have so far recovered from the disease, he said.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Bihar reports 2187 new infections in last 24 hours
details.content: 2,187 new COVID19 cases reported on 15th August in Bihar, taking the total count of active cases in the state to 35,056: State Health Department

details.title: Over 20 prisoners in Rajkot Central Jail test positive for COVID-19
details.content:
Rapid antigen tests were conducted on 94 inmates and results of 23 of them, including undertrials and convicts, came out positive on Saturday night. The infected inmates are asymptomatic and have been isolated.The jail authorities are in the process of hospitalising the infected inmates.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.content:

details.title: 97 nabbed for obscenity, flouting COVID-19 norms at Mumbai restaurant
details.content:
Based on some inputs, the police conducted a raid at the 'Bombay Brute' restaurant located on Link Road in suburban Jogeshwari where they found people dancing, consuming liquor and smoking hookah, the official said, adding that those nabbed were from well-off families.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: District Magistrates issued instructions head of forthcoming festivals
details.content:
Delhi Disaster Management Authority issues instructions to Dist Magistrates ahead of forthcoming festivals, in the wake of #COVID19. During Ganesh Chaturthi, no idol of Lord Ganesha to be set up in public places. No permission to be granted for procession during Moharram. pic.twitter.com/2sF18vGwER

— ANI (@ANI) August 16, 2020

details.title: Maha guv inaugurates Atma Nirbhar Bharat Cell of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University
details.content: Maharasthra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari inaugurated Atma Nirbhar Bharat Cell of Dr Babasaheb Ambedkar Technological University, Lonere virtually on 15th Aug. Cell has been created to promote innovation & creativity among youths & students from Maharashtra: Governor's office.

details.title: Many firsts in Parliament Monsoon Session 2020
details.content:
RS Chairman directs full preparedness by third week of August for Monsoon session of Parliament. Work is in progress at fast pace for ensuring several additional installations in prescribed time like four large display screens in the chamber of the House: Rajya Sabha Secretariat 

READ FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Thiruvananthapuram central prison remains COVID-19 hotbed as 145 inmates test positive in a day
details.content:
The total number of infections here rose to 362 after rapid antigen tests were conducted over the weekend. Of these, three are prisoner staff and the remaining are jail inmates. On Saturday, 53 have tested positive while 145 have tested positive on Sunday. The latest results have given way to a large cluster in the prison and its premises.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Rising COVID-19 cases lead to suspension of all regular activities at ISRO's Sriharikota rocket centre
details.content: "In view of the considerable number of Covid-19 positive cases in Shar and Sullurpeta housing colonies, it is essential to trace the primary contacts, test and isolate them to avoid further spread. All the office premises need to be fumigated and sanitised wherever the Covid positive employees had worked. Hence, the regular activities of SDSC Shar are suspended till completion of aforementioned activities," said Shar controller V Kumbakarnan, in an official circular dated August 15, which is accessed by The New Indian Express.

details.title: Assam to govt to decide on reopening of schools in state Aug 25
details.content: On August 1, state's education minister Himanta Biswa Sarma had announced that the state was preparing to reopen schools and colleges from September 1. “We are mentally preparing to reopen schools and colleges from September 1 pending the Central government’s approval,” he had then said.

details.title: UP reports 56 more deaths due to COVID
details.content: Number of COVID19 patients who have recovered from the disease crosses one lakh-mark in Uttar Pradesh; state reports 56 more fatalities due to the coronavirus, pushing the death toll to 2,449: Official

details.title: Don't want a second wave: Maharashtra CM
details.content:
Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray has said the process of lifting the lockdown in the state would be done in a stepwise manner. The threat of COVID-19 still persists, Thackeray said on Saturday, and added that he does not want a second wave of the deadly viral infection in the state.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Borders between Dakshina Kannada district and Kerala opened
details.content: Roads connecting Dakshina Kannada district in Karnataka to Kerala have been opened, says district collector. It may be noted that the borders of this region were sealed in the wake of rising coronavirus cases.

details.title: 10 more COVID-19 deaths in Haryana, 743 fresh cases
details.content: Ten more deaths due to COVID-19 were reported in Haryana on Sunday while 743 fresh cases took the tally of total infections in the state to 47,153, according to the health department's daily bulletin.

details.title: Dad breathing more comfortably: SPB's son Charan
details.content: Veteran playback singer S P Balasubrahmanyam being treated for COVID-19 isable to recognise people around him and is breathing a little more comfortably than before, his son and filmmaker S P Charan said on Sunday.

details.title: Now, see animals, birds of Kolkata zoo live from home  amid COVID
details.content: People will now be able to see the birds and animals of the Alipore zoo from their homes with the authorities starting live sessions on Facebook, as the city's one of the top destinations continues to remain closed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

details.title: Liquor shops to open in Chennai from Tuesday
details.content: After a long wait, the liquor shops in the limits of the Greater Chennai city police will open from Tuesday. The liquor outlets will be functioning from 10 am to 7 pm, said a statement from the government on Sunday.

details.title: Karnataka-Kerala border roads opened for inter-state travel
details.content: The Dakshina Kannada district of Karnataka has opened all border roads to Kasaragod district in Kerala, allowing inter-state travel of daily commuters with some regulations related to COVID-19 norms. As per the new order of Dakshina Kannada deputy commissioner K V Rajendra, the commuters would have to secure monthly passes from the local gram panchayat, municipality or town panchayat for their daily travel.

details.title: Family forced to carry dead body on bicycle in Karnataka's Belagavi amid COVID pandemic
details.content: After an incident of a dead body being carried on a pull cart was reported at Athani town, another heart-wrenching incident of a family transporting a dead body on a bicycle has come to light in Belagavi.

Amid the #COVID19 crisis, a lung transplant was done successfully at Hyderabad for a patient at KIMS Heart & Lung Transplant Institute while following #COVID__19 protocol, after the organ was airlifted from Pune.@XpressHyderabad @Gsn_tnie @KrishnaRaoCHVM

Express Photos pic.twitter.com/SZxd41eIzr

— The New Indian Express (@NewIndianXpress) August 16, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 recovery rate rises to over 90 per cent in Delhi
details.content: The recovery rate from COVID-19 in Delhi improved to more than 90 per cent on Sunday while 652 fresh cases were recorded, even as the state disaster management authority has prohibited pandals and processions on religious occasions due to the coronavirus pandemic.

details.title: West Bengal reports 3,066 new COVID-19 cases, 51 more deaths
details.content: West Bengal's COVID-19 toll rose to 2,428 with 51 more patients losing their lives on Sunday, as per an official bulletin. The state also reported 3,066 new cases of coronavirus infection, taking the tally to 1,16,498, the bulletin issued by the Health Department said.

In Mumbai, today 1010 new #COVID__19 positive cases, 719 recovery and 47 deaths are reported. @NewIndianXpress @Sunday_Standard pic.twitter.com/xJDi9ZAiQd

— Sudhir Suryawanshi (@ss_suryawanshi) August 16, 2020

details.title: 2,800 new cases in Pune; death toll reaches 3,022
details.content: Pune district in Maharashtra reported 2,800 new cases of coronavirus in the last 24 hours, taking the overall number to 1,25,197, a health official said on Sunday. The death toll in the district crossed the 3,000-mark to reach at 3,022 after 65 patients succumbed to the infection, he said.

details.title: Lord Ayyappa temple opens for monthly pooja
details.content: The famous Lord Ayyappa temple here opened on Sunday on the eve of the monthly five- day poojas for the Malayalam month of Chingam but the bar on devotees entry will continue as per COVID-19 health protocol. The temple will remain opentill August 21 and only the usual rituals will be conducted, the Travancore Devaswom Board (TDB), which manages the hill shrine, said.

details.title: COVID-19 cases in Amravati district reach 3,766
details.content: The COVID-19 tally in Maharashtra's Amravati district rose to 3,766 on Sunday with addition of 79 new cases, officials said. With no fatality being reported for the second consecutive day, the toll remained at 95.

details.title: 90 inmates of UP government shelter home for girls in Bareilly test COVID-19 positive
details.content: Ninety inmates of a government shelter home for girls here have tested positive for COVID-19, an official said on Sunday. Deputy Director of Women Welfare Department Nita Ahirwar said, "In the past two days, 90 inmates of Nari Niketan here have tested positive for COVID-19.

details.title: Bihar's COVID-19 caseload rises to 1.04 lakh; death toll mounts to 537
details.content: Bihar's COVID-19 caseload rose to 1. 04 lakh on Sunday as 2,187 more people tested positive for the infection, while 22 fresh fatalities pushed its coronavirus death toll to 537, a health bulletin said. Patna district registered the highest number of fresh cases at 255, followed by Bhagalpur (177), Madhubani (127), Aurangabad (113) and Muzaffarpur and Saharsa (97 each), it said.

details.title: 1,317 new cases push Assam's COVID-19 tally to 76,875
details.content: Assam's COVID-19 caseload shot up to 76,875 on Sunday as 1,317 more people tested positive for the infection, while seven fresh fatalities pushed its coronavirus death toll to 189, Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

details.title: Sikkim reports 19 new COVID-19 cases
details.content: Sikkim on Sunday recorded 19 new cases of COVID-19, taking the state's tally to 1,167, officials said. There are 463 active cases in the state at present, they said. Eight of the new cases were detected among those working in the state's pharma companies, they added.
